content:
Posted: August 12, 2015
												Play as the devil in a game resembling Oregon Trail but with battles. It's very slow with your limited moves per "day" on the map being used up quickly, and you'll find yourself on the camping screen a lot. Yet despite being on the evil side of history and moving at a glacial pace, I found myself coming back to this game anyway.The main weakness is that it badly needs an editor. I read that the "writing is good" but there are typos and bad grammar everywhere. It feels unprofessional.I'd still recommend it if you enjoy wandering around and exploring, which was the most enjoyable part for me.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												Great game. It's an adventure where you are a spanish conquistador. You have to gather much gold for spanish empire and/or conquist more lands. It's fully localized in lot of languages. The combat system is turn, the one i like. You have some resources to spend for upgrading your fortress/team/weapon. I love Iron Mode, it's similar to Hardcore mode in Diablo3: a character can die permanently. My vote is A.+Story+Combat system (turn)+Fully localized+Unique game+Lot of difficult levels-Short, if you run into main story.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
												I'm on my 3rd restart with this, why? because I learned a few things and decided to restart to impliment them, I think thats one of the keys here. The game can be time consuming as there is a lot of area to explore but, that's what I was hoping for when I bought it. There is some micro-management with your AI troops and that pretty good also. The graphics are not fantastic but good, the gameplay makes up for the average graphics. This is not something that can be done in a few days, at least not if you plan on playing for enjoyment. A big thing I learned is, this is a game where you save often, even if no natives are around, events can happen when you camp for the night, saving may save a lot of future problems, especially if you lose people in a battle.The more I play this the more I like it. I use a triple monitor system but run this on a single monitor, I think the aspect ratio may be off with 3 screens but I'm going to try it again as having 3 screens in this game is a big help for the player. This is more then worth the sale price of $5 but even at full price most will be happy, IMO.

content:
Posted: March 30
												Only 3.3 hours into the game (I've had to reload back to the beginning too) and I am unsure about this game. I get that it's meant to be D&Dish with the combat but when I'm being constantly hit by a bloody savage with a bow and poison arrow, or being crit hit multiple times in a row and my ranged musketman can't make a pointblank shot with 72% chance to hit multiple times in a row. I don't know, maybe I'm just unlucky, but I am constantly being rekt. Other than that, moving around the map is actually fun, exploring new areas, foraging and living off the land along with the random events that occur is actually quite enjoyable. Maybe get it if you're feeling lucky or just want to try your hand at killing dirty, heathen, savages.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 28
												Enjoyable turn based strategy game set in Conquistador Mexico. The game has solid mechanics and graphics. Only the skill system could be better to allow for more interesting character builds. Combat is fun and requires some strategic thinking. The story is okay and various decision points allow you to make it your own. However, I would have enjoyed if the smaller decisions had more impact. There is two factions which you can side with that alter how the game unfolds. There is side stories based on which characters you picked, but they are not worth mentioning. After having finished the game once, I am not sure I willing to replay the other faction though, as there will likely be a lot of repetition. But recommended anyways.

												They say its RNG...... its not, it is plain cheating, and prolonging the game by making you lose. If enemy has 41 health, and your lowest damage roll is 40, guess what will happen. Interesting story, good idea, but horrible combat execution. I was angry, irritated and frustrated most of the time.
